citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)
citations.narrative:
Proposed animal use activities are sent for review to all members of the IACUC via email. The email instructs the IACUC
members to return their responses to several questions pertaining to the proposed animal use activity by a specified date.
One of the questions asks the IACUC members if they vote to approve the proposed animal use activity. The approval of
proposed animal use activities by the members of the IACUC is taking place by a process other than at a convened
meeting of the IACUC (FCR) or by designated member review (DMR).
Per this Section, approval of proposed activities that involve the care and use of animals may be granted only after review
at a convened meeting of a quorum of the IACUC with the approval vote of a majority of the quorum present (FCR). This
Section also permits that proposed animal use activities can be reviewed by at least one member of the IACUC chosen by
the committee Chairperson as the designated reviewer who has authority to approve, require modifications to secure
approval, or request full Committee review of the animal use activities (DMR). The use of email communications by the
members of the IACUC to vote for approval of proposed animal use activities does not comply with the requirement of
voting at a convened meeting of a quorum of the IACUC and it does not comply with the designated member review
method. The research facility needs to review and approve proposed activities that involve the care and use of animals at
either a convened meeting of a quorum of IACUC members or via the designated member review process. Correct by
9/12/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
